stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.

stadium.name: The Cliffside Pitch
stadium.description: A perilous, windswept field built next to the town's lighthouse. There is no ocean-side barrier, and the wind is notoriously unpredictable. The tusk-like lighthouse is the only landmark.

stats.pregame_ritual: Telling each other exaggerated lies about their own strength.
Stretching their hamstrings for exactly seven minutes.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Adjusting their codpiece with theatrical importance.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.
Muttering a nonsensical rhyme to ward off bad spirits.
Filing down a single fingernail into a sharp point.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Wearing a necklace of polished river stones.

preGame:
### üèüÔ∏è Welcome to the Unruly Yard! Game Two is LIVE! üèüÔ∏è

Well, pull up a crate and mind the graffiti, folks! We are coming to you live from the heart of New Monteforte at **The Unruly Yard**, where the air smells of rebellion and the crowd is currently throwing half-eaten cabbages at the referee! This is Game Two of our Best of Three playoff series, and the tension is high enough to make a gargoyle sweat! The Southport Narwhals are leading the series 1-0, but they're walking into a literal lion's den today. If the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures don't pull out a win here, they'll be packing their bags for the loser's bracket faster than Sir Tanos runs from a library! üèõÔ∏èüí•

I‚Äôve been watching the sidelines, and the pre-game rituals are as bizarre as a three-headed calf! **Boulanger Procto** of the Chaos Creatures is currently ignoring the hostile fans to arrange his gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral. It‚Äôs almost poetic‚Äîif poetry involved heavy broadswords! Meanwhile, over in the Narwhals' dugout, **Braden Gaile** is muttering a nonsensical rhyme to ward off bad spirits. I hope that rhyme includes a verse about avoiding the Unstable Scaffolding behind him, because that thing looks like it was built by a drunk goblin! üåÄüó£Ô∏è

Speaking of spirits, let‚Äôs talk about the fan engagement! Or lack thereof! My goodness, looking at the popularity scores, it seems the people of Osterra are too busy fawning over the Zmeigorod Snessengers to witness this masterclass of mayhem! It‚Äôs a crime, I tell you! These two teams are out here ready to spill actual blood for the sport, and the 'Heroes' are probably off having a tea party with Maple the Tree. Don't worry, fans‚ÄîNok the Corrupter is here to give you the grisly details you crave! ü©∏‚ú®

This stadium is a real piece of work! Between the Rowdy Crowd and the Street Performers juggling flaming daggers in the end zone, the Narwhals are going to have a hard time focusing. They‚Äôre used to the salt air of the Cliffside Pitch, not the urban chaos of New Monteforte! Can the Chaos Creatures use their home-field advantage to tie this series, or will the Narwhals spear them and move on? The whistle is about to blow, and I‚Äôm vibrating with excitement! Let‚Äôs get some Trollball! ü¶àüÜöüëπ
postGame:
### üèÜ The Chaos Creatures Bite Back! Series Tied 1-1! üèÜ

Holy smokes, what a magnificent display of urban warfare! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures have defended their home turf with a punishing 2-0 victory over the Southport Narwhals! This playoff series is now officially deadlocked, and we are headed to a Game Three! If you like sports that look more like a back-alley brawl in the Guild of the Black Sky, then this was the game for you! üèôÔ∏è‚öîÔ∏è

The action started immediately in Center Field when **Raouf Dragone** scooped up the troll head, but the celebration was short-lived. **Cibis Areta**, showing that Narwhal ferocity, delivered a tackle so hard it sent Raouf straight to the healer‚Äôs tent! It was a beautiful sight, folks‚Äîthe kind of hit that would make Dame Terra Monteforte reconsider her career in dirt wizardry! üöëüí•

But the Chaos Creatures weren't about to let the Narwhals dominate the casualty list. **Blanc Fantasia** tried to make a move, but he was met with the business end of a Chaos defense that was absolutely rabid. In the ensuing scramble, Blanc managed to injure **Mouldon Earl**, proving that even when the Narwhals are losing ground, they‚Äôre still taking limbs! üçñü©π

The violence didn't stop there! **Cilurzo Sochor** for the Narwhals decided to play 'hammer and anvil' with **Placido Kora's** ribs, resulting in another injury! At this rate, I thought we‚Äôd need a second healer just to drag the bodies off the field. The 'Unruly Yard' crowd was loving every second of it, cheering louder with every crack of bone! üì£ü¶¥

Then came the play of the game! Amidst the sea of flying weapons and intercepted passes, **Boulanger Procto** found a pocket of space at the Away Field line. He didn't bother running; he just launched that troll head with the precision of a master assassin! It sailed through the goal for a spectacular two-point Shoot! The crowd went absolutely nuclear! üéØüî•

We hit Halftime with the score 2-0, and I‚Äôm sure the healers were earning their keep. When the second half started, the Narwhals looked desperate. **Braden Gaile** tried to spark a comeback, but instead, he ended up sparking a confrontation that left **Tucker Hett** injured on the turf. Braden might have a nonsensical rhyme, but he has a very sensible swing! ü•ä‚è≥

However, the Chaos Creatures had an answer for everything. **Crescint Sonia** of the Narwhals was a one-person wrecking crew, taking out **Wolbrom Ariella**, but the Creatures gave it right back! **Fogel Raynold** leveled Braden Gaile, sending the rhyme-mutterer to the sidelines for some much-needed quiet time! It was a carousel of carnage! üé†ü©∏

The game turned into a total defensive stalemate in the final minutes. **Wolbrom Ariella**‚Äîclearly not feeling the effects of their earlier tackle‚Äîcame back to take out **Fineman Dolhenty**! I haven't seen this much back-and-forth since the last time Sir Artorias tried to decide which 'Friend of the Fey' he liked best! üßö‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è‚öîÔ∏è

As the clock wound down, the Narwhals tried one last push, but **Crescint Sonia** ended up injuring **Fogel Raynold** in a desperate struggle for possession. It was too little, too late for the boys from Southport. The Chaos Creatures‚Äô defense held firm, fueled by the hostile energy of the Monteforte district! üõ°Ô∏èüèóÔ∏è

Final score: 2 to 0! The Chaos Creatures have forced a Game Three, and they did it with style, grit, and a fair amount of property damage! The 'Heroes' of Osterra could learn a thing or two about resilience from these squads. You don't see Sir Randy the Ranger getting his fancy bow dirty like this! üèπüí©

So, we are all tied up! One win apiece! The next game will determine who stays in the hunt for the championship and who gets relegated to the loser's bracket. My demon heart is pitter-pattering with joy at the thought of the tie-breaker! Get your bets in, get your bandages ready, and we‚Äôll see you for the finale! This is Nok the Corrupter, reminding you: if it doesn't bleed, it's not Trollball! üéôÔ∏èüòà
